description: Start with a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2. Thereafter, if a(n) is prime, a(n+1) = a(n) + 1. If a(n) is composite, look for its greatest factor other than itself (k, say) earlier in the sequence. If k is found, a(n+1) = a(n) + the number of steps back to the most recent appearance of k. If k is not found, a(n+1) = a(n) - k.
